org.modelio.gproject.gproject

Class GProjectConfigurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.gproject.gproject.GProjectConfigurer

  • public class GProjectConfigurer
extends Object
    Reconfigure an opened project with a new project descriptor.

    This class will be redefined in GUI plugins to update the modules.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GProjectConfigurer.Failure
      Represents the failure of a module operation.

      • getProject

      • getFailures

        public List<GProjectConfigurer.Failure> getFailures()
        Get the list of fragments or modules that couldn't be installed/removed or modified.
        Returns:
        the failures list.

      • reconfigure

        public final void reconfigure(ProjectDescriptor newDesc,
                              IModelioProgress monitor)
        Reconfigure the project with the given new descriptor.

        Replaces the project content. Old fragments will be removed, new ones will be added and mount.

        Parameters:
        newDesc - the new project description
        monitor - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.

      • synchronize

        public boolean synchronize(IModelioProgress monitor)
                    throws GProjectAuthenticationException,
                           IOException
        Synchronize the project against its remote configuration.

        Does nothing on local projects.

        Parameters:
        monitor - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration was changed, false if no change was made.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of failure.
        GProjectAuthenticationException - in case of authentication error.

      • installModule

        protected void installModule(ModuleDescriptor fd,
                             IModelioProgress mon)
                      throws IOException
        Install a new module.

        May be redefined.

        Parameters:
        fd - the new module descriptor.
        mon - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of failure

        May be redefined.

        Parameters:

      • removeModule

        protected void removeModule(GModule m,
                            IModelioProgress mon)
                     throws IOException
        Uninstall a module.

        To be redefined to add other behavior.

        Parameters:
        m - the module to remove.
        mon - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.
        Throws:

      • reconfigureModule

        protected void reconfigureModule(GModule m,
                                 ModuleDescriptor desc,
                                 IModelioProgress mon)
                          throws IOException
        Default implementation replaces share scoped parameters with the news.

        Local scope parameters are left untouched. To be redefined for a better behavior.

        Parameters:
        m - the module to update
        desc - the new module parameters.
        mon - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of failure
